instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Liquid damage Boots but no green light no charging
threads.message:
I have a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board here
computer boots, does not charge battery. 
no green/orange light

was not booting, cleaned up <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> area where there was corrosion,  also corrosion near f7140 
f7140 showing .3ohms may be hardware resolution

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> 14.8v
ppdcin no short to ground
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area untouched by liquid
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> Stable at 8.6 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> not stable stable at 8.6 for about a second then falls off and takes about 10 seconds to bee stable for another moment

am i looking at a dead isl? 
or am i possibly gettting bad info to the isl making <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> jumping up and down?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Liquid damage Boots but no green light no charging
threads.message: If there is no green light I would first inspect/replace IO board and cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Liquid damage Boots but no green light no charging
threads.message: I was afraid of that, this is one of the io boards, i do not have, but i have one on order. will post back if i have any further issues after that gets in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Liquid damage Boots but no green light no charging
threads.message: You can check if ACOK is present from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Liquid damage Boots but no green light no charging
threads.message:
if you want to cheat you can do the following.

1) study what MAX9940 & TC7SZ08FEAPE look like on ANY unibody board from 2010-present or any retina board besides 12" macbook.
2) look at your DC in board and identify these two.
3) run <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> via jumper wires from the mainboard to the DC in board.

Don't do this as a final fix, but it is a way of testing if it works. The airs use the same onewire circuit as the unibodies and retinas do, the chips are interchangeable, the pinouts are the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Liquid damage Boots but no green light no charging
threads.message: Louis! That is a great Cheat! I will have to try it next time, I did get lucky and it was just corrosion on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3HOT</SIGNAL> and a bad i/o board. Now i need to order another one to keep one for testing purposes.
